segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 14
segments.en: Linked Discourses 14

segments.pli: 4. Catutthavagga
segments.en: 4. The Fourth Chapter

segments.pli: 31. Pubbesambodhasutta
segments.en: 31. Before Awakening

segments.pli: Sāvatthiyaṃ viharati.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Pubbeva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
segments.en: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I thought:

segments.pli: ‘ko nu kho pathavīdhātuyā assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇaṃ;
segments.en: ‘What’s the gratification, the drawback, and the escape when it comes to the earth element …

segments.pli: ko āpodhātuyā assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇaṃ;
segments.en: the water element …

segments.pli: ko tejodhātuyā assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇaṃ;
segments.en: the fire element …

segments.pli: ko vāyodhātuyā assādo, ko ādīnavo, kiṃ nissaraṇan’ti?
segments.en: and the air element?’

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to me:

segments.pli: ‘yaṃ kho pathavīdhātuṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ pathavīdhātuyā assādo;
segments.en: ‘The pleasure and happiness that arise from the earth element: this is its gratification.

segments.pli: yaṃ pathavīdhātu aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṃ pathavīdhātuyā ādīnavo;
segments.en: That the earth element is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.

segments.pli: yo pathavīdhātuyā chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, idaṃ pathavīdhātuyā nissaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the earth element: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Yaṃ āpodhātuṃ paṭicca … pe …
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the water element …

segments.pli: yaṃ tejodhātuṃ paṭicca … pe …
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the fire element …

segments.pli: yaṃ vāyodhātuṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ, ayaṃ vāyodhātuyā assādo;
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from the air element: this is its gratification.

segments.pli: yaṃ vāyodhātu aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, ayaṃ vāyodhātuyā ādīnavo;
segments.en: That the air element is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.

segments.pli: yo vāyodhātuyā chandarāgavinayo chandarāgappahānaṃ, idaṃ vāyodhātuyā nissaraṇaṃ’.
segments.en: Removing and giving up desire and greed for the air element: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Yāvakīvañcāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ catunnaṃ dhātūnaṃ evaṃ assādañca assādato ādīnavañca ādīnavato nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ na abbhaññāsiṃ, neva tāvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti paccaññāsiṃ.
segments.en: As long as I didn’t truly understand these four elements’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I didn’t announce my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

segments.pli: Yato ca khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imāsaṃ catunnaṃ dhātūnaṃ evaṃ assādañca assādato ādīnavañca ādīnavato nissaraṇañca nissaraṇato yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, athāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya anuttaraṃ sammāsambodhiṃ abhisambuddhoti paccaññāsiṃ.
segments.en: But when I did truly understand these four elements’ gratification, drawback, and escape in this way for what they are, I announced my supreme perfect awakening in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans.

segments.pli: Ñāṇañca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi:
segments.en: Knowledge and vision arose in me:

segments.pli: ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’”ti.
segments.en: ‘My freedom is unshakable; this is my last rebirth; now there are no more future lives.’”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Before his awakening the Buddha saw the gratification, the drawback, and the escape in the four material elements.
